[{"id":"RF-7","entityId":"95-16","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"RF"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"7"},{"name":"summary","value":"Exporter: Family not found"},{"name":"description","value":"
Analyze case from real life
"},{"name":"created","value":"1491499111054"},{"name":"updated","value":"1492534501250"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"dsegui"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"dsegui"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"dsegui"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"dsegui"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"4"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"dsegui","fullName":"dsegui"}]},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Gedcom"],"valueId":["Gedcom"],"color":{"bg":"#a6e0fc","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Kanban State","value":["Blocked"],"valueId":["Blocked"],"color":{"bg":"#ffc8ea","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Stage","value":["Implemented"],"valueId":["Implemented"],"color":null},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"First sprint","id":"RootsFinder Kanban Board:First sprint"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"105-0","author":"dsegui","authorFullName":"dsegui","issueId":"RF-7","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
https://sentry.io/rootscity/gedcom-importer-java/issues/247644248/
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1491499160906,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"105-2","author":"dsegui","authorFullName":"dsegui","issueId":"RF-7","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
I don´t have the tree info for this error, I fix the code to prevent this to happen again, but I couldn´t analyze this case.- Next time I get the same warn, I'll do it
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1491525098336,"updated":1491499160902,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"105-14","author":"Dallan","authorFullName":"Dallan Quass","issueId":"RF-7","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
dsegui I found the issue. These ordinances are coming from a GEDCOM import. It looks like when we import sealing to spouse ordinances from a GEDCOM, we don't set spouseId.

Here's what I want you to do: When you import a SealingToSpouse ordinance in a GEDCOM, it should be on a Family object. If it is, then put the RootsFinder personId of the spouse in the ordinance's spouseId field. I realize this will be a RootsFinder personId, not a FamilySearch personId, so when we have a gedcom-uploaded ordinance, spouseId will be a numeric RootsFinder personId, and when we have a familysearch-downloaded ordinances, spouseId will be an alpha-numeric FamilySearch personId. When you do the export, you'll have to detect whether the spouseId is numeric or alpha-numeric. If it's numeric, then look up the spouse based upon the RootsFinder personId; otherwise look up the spouse based upon the person's FamilySearch external id. How does that sound?
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1492308109851,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"105-18","author":"dsegui","authorFullName":"dsegui","issueId":"RF-7","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Also a new case with spouseId:
https://sentry.io/rootscity/gedcom-importer-java/issues/247644248/
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1492475002835,"updated":1491525098334,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]}],"tag":[{"value":"Gedcom Exporter","cssClass":"c4"}]}, {"id":"RF-36","entityId":"95-75","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"RF"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"36"},{"name":"summary","value":"Warning Hints"},{"name":"description","value":" "},{"name":"created","value":"1491933823170"},{"name":"updated","value":"1492474632074"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"dsegui"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"dsegui"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"dsegui"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"dsegui"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"dsegui","fullName":"dsegui"}]},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Hints"],"valueId":["Hints"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Kanban State","value":["Blocked"],"valueId":["Blocked"],"color":{"bg":"#ffc8ea","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Stage","value":["In process"],"valueId":["In process"],"color":null},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"First sprint","id":"RootsFinder Kanban Board:First sprint"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"105-5","author":"dsegui","authorFullName":"dsegui","issueId":"RF-36","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
https://paper.dropbox.com/doc/Warning-List-9clGNRgqHPB4LJ0WTE0AU
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1491933902359,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"RF-43","entityId":"95-89","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"RF"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"43"},{"name":"summary","value":"Set preferredParentsFamilyId"},{"name":"description","value":"
if a person has multiple sets of parents in the gedcom, you need to set the person's preferredParentsFamilyId to the first family appearing in the gedcom. Currently it looks like preferredParentsFamilyId is not being set
"},{"name":"created","value":"1492019048291"},{"name":"updated","value":"1492146029553"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"dsegui"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"dsegui"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"Dallan"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Dallan Quass"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"0"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"Priority","value":["Major"],"valueId":["Major"],"color":{"bg":"#ffee9c","fg":"#b45f06"}},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"dsegui","fullName":"dsegui"}]},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Gedcom"],"valueId":["Gedcom"],"color":{"bg":"#a6e0fc","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Kanban State","value":["Blocked"],"valueId":["Blocked"],"color":{"bg":"#ffc8ea","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Stage","value":["Implemented"],"valueId":["Implemented"],"color":null},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"First sprint","id":"RootsFinder Kanban Board:First sprint"}]}],"comment":[],"tag":[]}, {"id":"RF-40","entityId":"95-83","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"RF"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"40"},{"name":"summary","value":"People should not be set to living when they have a death event"},{"name":"description","value":"
It looks like you set living to TRUE if you can't parse the death date. I will send you a GEDCOM where this is happening. If the "death" or "burial" date matches one of the words in iPerson.hasKeywords() then we should set living to TRUE; otherwise if there is a death/burial event, we should set living to "" (the empty string) if you can't parse the date, or set living to "FALSE" if you can parse the date.
"},{"name":"created","value":"1491958635846"},{"name":"updated","value":"1492105193537"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"Dallan"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Dallan Find spouse for each MARR event, and search the hint using both names
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1491518305006,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]}],"tag":[{"value":"NewsPaper Hint","cssClass":"c9"}]}, {"id":"RF-28","entityId":"95-58","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"RF"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"28"},{"name":"summary","value":"Note handling for families"},{"name":"description","value":"
This user makes a good point. Currently, we attach the notes in a family to all family members. But we'd be better off just attaching them to the husband and wife.

I've attached her GEDCOM. In it, she is I1667 (Joy Davis). She is the child of family F149. That family has a note N5622. We attached that note to everyone in the family, including her. But I think she is right - we should attach Family notes only to the husband and wife.

Could you fix this tomorrow and let me know when you've fixed it? Then I will let her know.
"},{"name":"created","value":"1491843722169"},{"name":"updated","value":"1491930952059"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"dsegui"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"dsegui"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"Dallan"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Dallan Quass"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"0"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"Priority","value":["Major"],"valueId":["Major"],"color":{"bg":"#ffee9c","fg":"#b45f06"}},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"dsegui","fullName":"dsegui"}]},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Gedcom"],"valueId":["Gedcom"],"color":{"bg":"#a6e0fc","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Kanban State","value":["Blocked"],"valueId":["Blocked"],"color":{"bg":"#ffc8ea","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Stage","value":["Implemented"],"valueId":["Implemented"],"color":null},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"First sprint","id":"RootsFinder Kanban Board:First sprint"}]}],"comment":[],"tag":[]}, {"id":"RF-26","entityId":"95-55","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"RF"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"26"},{"name":"summary","value":"Better name handling"},{"name":"description","value":"
I have another GEDCOM issue for you. A few days ago someone uploaded a GEDCOM that had names that looked like this:
1 NAME Петр Иванович /Дерусов/
2 GIVN Петр Иванович

There's no SURN field. Just the NAME and GIVN fields. How about this? If we don't have a SURN field, could you fill in the SURN field from the part of the NAME within /'s?
"},{"name":"created","value":"1491709832177"},{"name":"updated","value":"1491873581127"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"dsegui"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"dsegui"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"Dallan"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Dallan Quass"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"0"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"Priority","value":["Major"],"valueId":["Major"],"color":{"bg":"#ffee9c","fg":"#b45f06"}},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"dsegui","fullName":"dsegui"}]},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Gedcom"],"valueId":["Gedcom"],"color":{"bg":"#a6e0fc","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Kanban State","value":["Blocked"],"valueId":["Blocked"],"color":{"bg":"#ffc8ea","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Stage","value":["Implemented"],"valueId":["Implemented"],"color":null},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"First sprint","id":"RootsFinder Kanban Board:First sprint"}]}],"comment":[],"tag":[{"value":"Gedcom Importer","cssClass":"c3"}]}]
